Posts.EditableText:
Scratch video. I tried to get it to work using html5 (which the offline browser currently doesn't support but should in the next update) and couldn't get it to work. Which leaves you with linking to youtube videos which, to me at least, would grate as you'd get the console too rather than a clean autoplay sequence and you're reliant on internet speeds. 

Both audio and images can be done. My game contains both but won't be ready for months unfortunately. I have seen both used. First Times uses audio, but not seamlessly. I did see a game with great images but it was a beta and it vanished into the sandpit. 
I'd never make media integral to the game though. At the end of the day, this is interactive fiction so people expect words. Media can jazz it up but not to make it unplayable without those elements, imo.
